resources.string: Add a more accurate description of your note here!
If you are reading this there are some problems
Note completed, no need for reminder
Are you really sure?\nDeleted notes cannot be recovered
Do you really want to delete the audio record?
Do you really want to delete the image attachment?
Note attachment chosen by the user
You haven\'t assigned any tag yet
Green = Note Completed\nBlue = Note Planned (you haven\'t done it yet but you still haven\'t reach your deadline)\nRed = Note Expired (the due date is passed but you haven\'t completed the task)

Text details: you can assign a title, a description and some other more specific attributes useful for organizing your tasks (e.g. tags, grade of importance etc)
Alarm: you can choose to turn it on to receive a reminder notification at the time set
 Sub activities: need to go grocery shopping? We got you covered!
 Attachments: too busy to write down a note in every detail? Just snap a photo or record an audio message related to the task. Quick and easy!
I have accidentally deleted from the gallery an image used in a note…
Don\'t worry, 321DO! saves it\'s own copy of the image so you can safely delete the original file to free space (this doesn\'t applies to audios).
Can I recover a deleted note? What about a deleted attachment?

No, you cannot recover a deleted note, you have however a limited time to cancel the delete operation immediately after (a quick UNDO option should appear on the bottom of the screen).\nWhen you delete a note, every attachment is also deleted (otherwise it will occupy memory in vain); audio messages in particular are not recoverable (for images see previous question).
Making a note is quick, but I want to be quicker!
You can, just add the 321DO! widget to your home!

1. You set a date and a time from the edit options
2. When the given time comes you will receive a notification
3. The notification will give you three options, complete the task, dimiss the task (that will then be considered expired) and snooze the alarm.
 The expanded notification will also show you all the details regarding the pending task.
4. If you choose to snooze the notification you will have to pick a costum amount of time and the alarm will be represented to you later

You can assign a tag to each note to organize them by your needs.
 By default there aren't any tag, a tag is created every time the user assign a new one to a note.
Existing tags will be suggested during the editing of the notes.
 You can also use the search bar to find notes that contains a given tag.
What happens when I clone a note?

A new note is created and every textual information is copied from the original note, the other fields are set to default values.\n Attachments are not copied to preserve memory, due dates and alarms neither because you are probably going to set a new one right?
You said default values, what does that mean?

When you create a note you probably won't have time to choose each detail so 321DO! covers you by filling the following field with the following values:
 Title - Current time
 Due Date - Tomorrow morning
 Priority and Urgency - Normal
 Attachments - None
 Every other field is left blank.

321DO! is an app created entirely by me, Luca Alessio: I\'m a bachelor student in Computer Science at University of Padua and I\'ve worked on this application during my stage period at Ceremit srl.\nI\'ve found a bit hard to enter in the world of Android Development so I intend to share what I\'ve learned with other students and enthusiasts: you can find the source code (in all it\'s glory and bad practices) here:\nhttps://github.com/lalessio/321do
If you have any questions (or want to donate something via Paypal <3) you can contact me at\nlucaalessio@gmail.com
You have the following tasks to do:
